verses.meaning: Salutations to the sacred sandals of my Guru, which serve as a boat to cross the endless ocean of worldly existence, which bestow devotion to the Guru, and which are worthy of worship by those seeking the kingdom of renunciation.

Salutations to the sacred sandals of my Guru, which are like the moon causing the ocean of poetry to swell, which are like rain clouds that extinguish the forest fire of misfortune, and which remove the calamities of those who bow before them.

verses.sanskrit:
नताजनाभीष्टततिप्रदाभ्यां नाधीश्वराभ्यां नमो नमस्ते।
नमः पराभ्यां परदेवताभ्यां नमो नमः श्रीगुरुपादुकाभ्याम्॥
verses.transliteration:
natājanābhīṣṭatatipradābhyāṃ nādhīśvarābhyāṃ namo namaste।
namaḥ parābhyāṃ paradevatābhyāṃ namo namaḥ śrīgurupādukābhyām॥
verses.meaning: Salutations to the sacred sandals of my Guru, which grant the desired fruits to those who bow before them, which are the lords of speech and sound, which are supreme, and which are the highest divinity.

Salutations to the sacred sandals of my Guru, which are like a succession of suns dispelling the darkness of sin, which are like Garuda destroying the serpents of three-fold suffering, and which are like the submarine fire that dries up the ocean of dullness.

Salutations to the sacred sandals of my Guru, which bestow the six spiritual treasures beginning with tranquility, which initiate one into the vow of bestowing samadhi, and which grant steady devotion to the feet of Lord Vishnu.

verses.sanskrit:
स्वार्चापराणां अखिलेष्टदाभ्यां स्वाहास्वधाभ्यां नमो नमस्ते।
स्वर्गापवर्गैकपन्थानाभ्यां नमो नमः श्रीगुरुपादुकाभ्याम्॥
verses.transliteration:
svārcāparāṇāma akhileṣṭadābhyāṃ svāhāsvadhābhyāṃ namo namaste।
svargāpavargaikapanthānābhyāṃ namo namaḥ śrīgurupādukābhyām॥
verses.meaning: Salutations to the sacred sandals of my Guru, which grant all desires to those whose highest aim is self-worship, which embody the sacred utterances Svaha and Svadha, and which are the sole path to both heaven and liberation.

verses.transliteration:
kāmādisarpavrajagaruḍābhyāṃ vivekavairāgyanid hipradābhyām।
bodhapradābhyāṃ drutamokṣadābhyāṃ namo namaḥ śrīgurupādukābhyām॥
verses.meaning: Salutations to the sacred sandals of my Guru, which are like Garuda to the serpents of desire and other passions, which bestow the treasure of discrimination and dispassion, which grant enlightenment, and which quickly bestow liberation.

verses.transliteration:
anantasaṃsāraviṣodgarībhyāṃ śrīśaṅkarāyātanamandir ābhyām।
akāmapūjyābhyāṃ tṛṇāya namaḥ śrīgurupādukābhyām॥
verses.meaning: Salutations to the sacred sandals of my Guru, which neutralize the poison of endless worldly existence, which are the temples where Lord Shankara is enshrined, and which are worshipped selflessly for ultimate knowledge.
